parameters.name: sinceTimestamp
parameters.description:
Timestamp to retrieve candles since, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`. Required field.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description:
Time interval for the candles. Required field.

 - INTERVAL_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - INTERVAL_I1M: 1 minute.
 - INTERVAL_I5M: 5 minutes.
 - INTERVAL_I15M: 15 minutes.
 - INTERVAL_I1H: 1 hour.
 - INTERVAL_I6H: 6 hours.
 - INTERVAL_I1D: 1 day.

parameters.description: Max depth limits the number of levels returned. Default is 0, which returns all levels.

parameters.description: Skip the number of records specified. Default is 0.

parameters.name: pagination.limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of returned records to the value specified. Default is 50.

parameters.name: pagination.descending

Descending reverses the order of the records returned.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Account type. Required field.

 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_INSURANCE: Insurance pool accounts contain insurance pool funds for a market.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_SETTLEMENT: Settlement accounts exist only during settlement or mark-to-market.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_MARGIN: Margin accounts contain margin funds for a party and each party will
have multiple margin accounts, one for each market they have traded in.

Margin account funds will alter as margin requirements on positions change.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL: General accounts contains general funds for a party. A party will
have multiple general accounts, one for each asset they want
to trade with.

General accounts are where funds are initially deposited or withdrawn from.
It is also the account where funds are taken to fulfil fees and initial margin requirements.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_INFRASTRUCTURE: Infrastructure accounts contain fees earned by providing infrastructure on Vega.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_LIQUIDITY: Liquidity accounts contain fees earned by providing liquidity on Vega markets.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_MAKER: This account is created to hold fees earned by placing orders that sit on the book
and are then matched with an incoming order to create a trade.
These fees reward traders who provide the best priced liquidity that actually allows trading to take place.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCK_WITHDRAW: This account is created to lock funds to be withdrawn by parties

parameters.name: selectInState.value
parameters.description:
Proposal state value.

 - STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - STATE_FAILED: Proposal enactment has failed - even though proposal has passed, its execution could not be performed.
 - STATE_OPEN: Proposal is open for voting.
 - STATE_PASSED: Proposal has gained enough support to be executed.
 - STATE_REJECTED: Proposal wasn't accepted (proposal terms failed validation due to wrong configuration or failing to meet network requirements).
 - STATE_DECLINED: Proposal didn't get enough votes (either failing to gain required participation or majority level).
 - STATE_ENACTED: Proposal enacted.
 - STATE_WAITING_FOR_NODE_VOTE: Waiting for node validation of the proposal

Default is true, if false the results will be returned in ascending order.

OrderTimeInForce.description:
Time in Force for an order.
See [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail.

 - TIF_UNSPECIFIED: Default value for TimeInForce, can be valid for an amend.
 - TIF_GTC: Good until cancelled.
 - TIF_GTT: Good until specified time.
 - TIF_IOC: Immediate or cancel.
 - TIF_FOK: Fill or kill.
 - TIF_GFA: good for auction
 - TIF_GFN: good for normal

ProposalState.description:
Proposal state transition:
Open ->
  - Passed -> Enacted.
  - Passed -> Failed.
  - Declined
Rejected
Proposal can enter Failed state from any other state.

 - STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - STATE_FAILED: Proposal enactment has failed - even though proposal has passed, its execution could not be performed.
 - STATE_OPEN: Proposal is open for voting.
 - STATE_PASSED: Proposal has gained enough support to be executed.
 - STATE_REJECTED: Proposal wasn't accepted (proposal terms failed validation due to wrong configuration or failing to meet network requirements).
 - STATE_DECLINED: Proposal didn't get enough votes (either failing to gain required participation or majority level).
 - STATE_ENACTED: Proposal enacted.
 - STATE_WAITING_FOR_NODE_VOTE: Waiting for node validation of the proposal

VoteValue.description:
Vote value.

 - VALUE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - VALUE_NO: A vote against the proposal.
 - VALUE_YES: A vote in favour of the proposal.

id.description: Unique account identifier (used internally by Vega).

owner.description:
The party that the account belongs to. Special values include `network`, which represents the Vega network and is
most commonly seen during liquidation of distressed trading positions.

balance.description:
Balance of the asset, the balance is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places. Balances cannot be negative.

marketID.description: Market identifier for the account. If [`AccountType`](#vega.AccountType).`ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL` this will be empty.

type.description: The account type related to this account.

vegaAccount.description: Represents an account for an asset on Vega for a particular owner or party.

vegaAccountType.description:
Various collateral/account types as used by Vega.

 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_INSURANCE: Insurance pool accounts contain insurance pool funds for a market.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_SETTLEMENT: Settlement accounts exist only during settlement or mark-to-market.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_MARGIN: Margin accounts contain margin funds for a party and each party will
have multiple margin accounts, one for each market they have traded in.

Margin account funds will alter as margin requirements on positions change.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_GENERAL: General accounts contains general funds for a party. A party will
have multiple general accounts, one for each asset they want
to trade with.

General accounts are where funds are initially deposited or withdrawn from.
It is also the account where funds are taken to fulfil fees and initial margin requirements.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_INFRASTRUCTURE: Infrastructure accounts contain fees earned by providing infrastructure on Vega.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_LIQUIDITY: Liquidity accounts contain fees earned by providing liquidity on Vega markets.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_FEES_MAKER: This account is created to hold fees earned by placing orders that sit on the book
and are then matched with an incoming order to create a trade.
These fees reward traders who provide the best priced liquidity that actually allows trading to take place.
 - ACCOUNT_TYPE_LOCK_WITHDRAW: This account is created to lock funds to be withdrawn by parties

vegaAddValidator.description: A message to notify when a new validator is being added to the Vega network.

name.description: Name of the asset (e.g: Great British Pound).

totalSupply.description: Total circulating supply for the asset.

decimals.description: Number of decimals / precision handled by this asset.

source.title: The definition of the external source for this asset

vegaAsset.description: The Vega representation of an external asset.

duration.description: Duration of the auction in seconds.

vegaAuctionDuration.description:
An auction duration is used to configure 3 auction periods:
1. `duration > 0`, `volume == 0`:
  The auction will last for at least N seconds.
2. `duration == 0`, `volume > 0`:
  The auction will end once we can close with given traded volume.
3. `duration > 0`, `volume > 0`:
  The auction will take at least N seconds, but can end sooner if we can trade a certain volume.

vegaBusEvent.title:
BusEvent wraps around the event data emited by the core. All messages have the event ID, and the type flag.
the actual data is set as a oneof field

vegaBusEventType.title: event types, 2 groups: actual single values, and then some events that capture a group of events

timestamp.description:
Timestamp for the point in time when the candle was initially created/opened, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

datetime.description: An ISO-8601 datetime with nanosecond precision for when the candle was last updated.

high.description: Highest price for trading during the candle interval.

low.description: Lowest price for trading during the candle interval.

volume.description: Total trading volume during the candle interval.

interval.description: Time interval for the candle. See [`Interval`](#vega.Interval).

vegaCandle.description:
Represents the high, low, open, and closing prices for an interval of trading,
referred to commonly as a candlestick or candle.

txID.description: The identifier of the transaction in which the events happened, usually a hash.

nonce.description: Arbitrary one-time integer used to prevent replay attacks.

vegaChainEvent.description: An event forwarded to the Vega network to provide information on events happening on other networks.

vegaChainStatus.description:
The Vega blockchain status as reported by the node the caller is connected to.

 - CHAIN_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - CHAIN_STATUS_DISCONNECTED: Blockchain is disconnected.
 - CHAIN_STATUS_REPLAYING: Blockchain is replaying historic transactions.
 - CHAIN_STATUS_CONNECTED: Blockchain is connected and receiving transactions.

asset.title: The vega asset targeted by this deposit

txHash.title: The hash of the transaction from the foreign chain

creditedTimestamp.title: The time where the vega account got updated with the deposit

createdTimestamp.title: The time the deposit has been created in the vega network

vegaDeposit.title: The representation of a deposit in the vega network

vegaDepositStatus.description:
- DEPOSIT_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - DEPOSIT_STATUS_OPEN: The deposit is being processed by the network
 - DEPOSIT_STATUS_CANCELLED: The deposit has been cancelled by the network
 - DEPOSIT_STATUS_FINALIZED: The deposit has been finalized and accounts have been updated

durationNs.title: Duration in nanoseconds, maximum 1 month (2592000000000000 ns)

Risk model for external modelling.
Provided by external service via a Unix socket.

makerFee.description: Fee amount paid to the non-aggressive party of the trade.

infrastructureFee.description: Fee amount paid for maintaining the Vega infrastructure.

liquidityFee.description: Fee amount paid to market makers.

makerFee.description: Maker fee, needs to be a valid float.

liquidityFee.description: Liquidity fee, it needs to be a valid float.

vegaFeeFactorsConfiguration.description: FeeFactors set at the network level.

no.description: All "no" votes against the proposal above.

yesParty.description: All latest YES votes by party (guaranteed to be unique).

noParty.description: All latest NO votes by party (unique).

vegaIdentifier.description: Used as a wrapper type on any possible network address supported by Vega.

initialMarkPrice.description: An initial mark price for the instrument.

baseName.description: Base security used as the reference.

tags.description: A list of 0 or more tags.

vegaInterval.description:
Represents a set of time intervals that are used when querying for candle-stick data.

 - INTERVAL_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - INTERVAL_I1M: 1 minute.
 - INTERVAL_I5M: 5 minutes.
 - INTERVAL_I15M: 15 minutes.
 - INTERVAL_I1H: 1 hour.
 - INTERVAL_I6H: 6 hours.
 - INTERVAL_I1D: 1 day.

fromAccount.description: One or more accounts to transfer from.

toAccount.description: One or more accounts to transfer to.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp for the time the ledger entry was created, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

vegaLedgerEntry.description: Represents a ledger entry on Vega.

vegaLogNormalModelParams.description: Risk model parameters for log normal.

params.description: Risk model parameters for log normal.

vegaLossSocialization.title: LossSocialization event amount of wins unable to be distributed

timestamp.description:
Timestamp for the time the ledger entry was created, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

vegaMarginLevels.description: Represents the margin levels for a party on a market at a given time.

decimalPlaces.title:
Number of decimal places that a price must be shifted by in order to get a correct price denominated in the currency of the market.
For example: `realPrice = price / 10^decimalPlaces`

openingAuction.description: Auction duration specifies how long the opening auction will run (minimum duration and optionally a minimum traded volume).

markPrice.description:
Mark price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

bestBidPrice.description:
Highest price level on an order book for buy orders, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

bestBidVolume.description: Aggregated volume being bid at the best bid price.

bestOfferPrice.description: Lowest price level on an order book for offer orders.

bestOfferVolume.description:
Aggregated volume being offered at the best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
 // formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

midPrice.description:
Arithmetic average of the best bid price and best offer price, as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
 // formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp at which this mark price was relevant, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

openInterest.description: The sum of the size of all positions greater than 0 on the market.

auctionEnd.description: Time in seconds until the end of the auction (0 if currently not in auction period).

auctionStart.description: Time until next auction (used in FBA's) - currently always 0.

indicativePrice.title: indicative price (zero if not in auction)

indicativeVolume.title: indicative volume (zero if not in auction)

marketState.title: the current state of the market

vegaMarketData.description: Represents data generated by a market when open.

buy.description: Collection of price levels for the buy side of the book.

sell.description: Collection of price levels for the sell side of the book.

sequenceNumber.title: Sequence number for the market depth dump

vegaMarketDepth.description: Represents market depth or order book data for the specified market on Vega.

vegaMarketEvent.title:
MarketEvent - the common denominator for all market events
interface has a method to return a string for logging

vegaMarketState.description:
What mode is the market currently running, also known as market state.

 - MARKET_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, this is invalid
 - MARKET_STATE_CONTINUOUS: Normal trading
 - MARKET_STATE_AUCTION: Auction trading

vegaMarketTick.title: Time update for each market, can be used to see when new markets actually started in terms of block-time

minCloseInSeconds.description: Constrains minimum duration since submission (in seconds) when vote closing time is allowed to be set for a proposal.

maxCloseInSeconds.description: Constrains maximum duration since submission (in seconds) when vote closing time is allowed to be set for a proposal.

minEnactInSeconds.description: Constrains minimum duration since submission (in seconds) when enactment is allowed to be set for a proposal.

maxEnactInSeconds.description: Constrains maximum duration since submission (in seconds) when enactment is allowed to be set for a proposal.

requiredParticipation.description: Participation level required for any proposal to pass. Value from `0` to `1`.

requiredMajority.description: Majority level required for any proposal to pass. Value from `0.5` to `1`.

minProposerBalance.description: Minimum balance required for a party to be able to submit a new proposal. Value greater than `0` to `1`.

minVoterBalance.description: Minimum balance required for a party to be able to cast a vote. Value greater than `0` to `1`.

marginConfiguration.description: Scaling factors for all markets created via governance.

feeFactorsConfiguration.description: FeeFactors which are not set via proposal.

decimalPlaces.description: Decimal places used for the new market.

metadata.description: Optional new market meta data, tags.

openingAuctionDuration.description: Time duration for the opening auction to last.

simple.title: Simple risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_SIMPLE is selected

logNormal.title: Log normal risk model parameters, valid only if MODEL_LOG_NORMAL is selected

vegaNewMarketConfiguration.description: Configuration for a new market on Vega.

ID.description: The identifier of the resource being signed.

kind.description: The kind of resource being signed.

vegaNodeSignature.description: Represents a signature from a validator, to be used by a foreign chain in order to recognise a decision taken by the Vega network.

vegaNodeSignatureKind.description:
The kind of the signature created by a node, for example, whitelisting a new asset, withdrawal etc.

 - NODE_SIGNATURE_KIND_UNSPECIFIED: represents a unspecified / missing value from the input
 - NODE_SIGNATURE_KIND_ASSET_NEW: represents a signature for a new asset whitelisting
 - NODE_SIGNATURE_KIND_ASSET_WITHDRAWAL: represents a signature for a asset withdrawal

id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus).

side.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL. See [`Side`](#vega.Side).

price.description:
Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts.

remaining.description: Size remaining, when this reaches 0 then the order is fully filled and status becomes STATUS_FILLED.

timeInForce.description:
Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires.
See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce).

createdAt.description:
Timestamp for when the order was created at, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

status.description:
The current status for the order. See [`Order.Status`](#vega.Order.Status).
For detail on `STATUS_REJECTED` please check the [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) value given in the `reason` field.

expiresAt.description:
Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`. Valid only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIF_GTT`.

reference.description:
Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus. Currently
set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission.

reason.description:
If the Order `status` is `STATUS_REJECTED` then an [`OrderError`](#vega.OrderError) reason will be specified.
The default for this field is `ORDER_ERROR_NONE` which signifies that there were no errors.

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp for when the Order was last updated, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

version.title: The version for the order, initial value is version 1 and is incremented after each successful amend

batchID.description:
Batch identifier for the order, used internally for orders submitted during auctions
to keep track of the auction batch this order falls under (required for fees calculation).

vegaOrder.description: An order can be submitted, amended and cancelled on Vega in an attempt to make trades with other parties.

orderID.description: Order identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated. Required field.

partyID.description: Party identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated. Required field.

marketID.description: Market identifier, this is required to find the order and will not be updated.

price.description: Amend the price for the order, if the Price value is set, otherwise price will remain unchanged. See [`Price`](#vega.Price).

sizeDelta.description:
Amend the size for the order by the delta specified.
To reduce the size from the current value set a negative integer value.
To increase the size from the current value, set a positive integer value.
To leave the size unchanged set a value of zero.

expiresAt.description:
Amend the expiry time for the order, if the Timestamp value is set, otherwise expiry time will remain unchanged.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

timeInForce.description:
Amend the time in force for the order, set to TIF_UNSPECIFIED to remain unchanged.
See [`TimeInForce`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

vegaOrderAmendment.description: An order amendment is a request to amend or update an existing order on Vega.

orderID.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus). Required field.

marketID.description: Market identifier for the order. Required field.

partyID.description: Party identifier for the order. Required field.

vegaOrderCancellation.description: An order cancellation is a request to cancel an existing order on Vega.

vegaOrderError.description:
OrderError codes are returned in the `[Order](#vega.Order).reason` field.
If there is an issue with an order during it's life-cycle, it will be marked with `status.ORDER_STATUS_REJECTED`.

 - ORDER_ERROR_NONE: Default value, no error reported.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_MARKET_ID: Order was submitted for a market that does not exist.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_ORDER_ID: Order was submitted with an invalid identifier.
 - ORDER_ERROR_OUT_OF_SEQUENCE: Order was amended with a sequence number that was not previous version + 1.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_REMAINING_SIZE: Order was amended with an invalid remaining size (e.g. remaining greater than total size).
 - ORDER_ERROR_TIME_FAILURE: Node was unable to get Vega (blockchain) time.
 - ORDER_ERROR_REMOVAL_FAILURE: Failed to remove an order from the book.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_EXPIRATION_DATETIME: An order with `TimeInForce.TIF_GTT` was submitted or amended
with an expiration that was badly formatted or otherwise invalid.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_ORDER_REFERENCE: Order was submitted or amended with an invalid reference field.
 - ORDER_ERROR_EDIT_NOT_ALLOWED: Order amend was submitted for an order field that cannot not be amended (e.g. order identifier).
 - ORDER_ERROR_AMEND_FAILURE: Amend failure because amend details do not match original order.
 - ORDER_ERROR_NOT_FOUND: Order not found in an order book or store.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_PARTY_ID: Order was submitted with an invalid or missing party identifier.
 - ORDER_ERROR_MARKET_CLOSED: Order was submitted for a market that has closed.
 - ORDER_ERROR_MARGIN_CHECK_FAILED: Order was submitted, but the party did not have enough collateral to cover the order.
 - ORDER_ERROR_MISSING_GENERAL_ACCOUNT: Order was submitted, but the party did not have an account for this asset.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INTERNAL_ERROR: Unspecified internal error.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_SIZE: Order was submitted with an invalid or missing size (e.g. 0).
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_PERSISTENCE: Order was submitted with an invalid persistence for its type.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_TYPE: Order was submitted with an invalid type field.
 - ORDER_ERROR_SELF_TRADING: Order was stopped as it would have traded with another order submitted from the same party.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS_TO_PAY_FEES: Order was submitted, but the party did not have enough collateral to cover the fees for the order.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INCORRECT_MARKET_TYPE: Order was submitted with an incorrect or invalid market type.
 - ORDER_ERROR_INVALID_TIME_IN_FORCE: Order was submitted with invalid time in force

vegaOrderStatus.description:
Status values for an order.
See resulting status in [What order types are available to trade on Vega?](https://docs.vega.xyz/docs/trading-questions/#what-order-types-are-available-to-trade-on-vega) for more detail.

 - STATUS_INVALID: Default value, always invalid.
 - STATUS_ACTIVE: Used for active unfilled or partially filled orders.
 - STATUS_EXPIRED: Used for expired GTT orders.
 - STATUS_CANCELLED: Used for orders cancelled by the party that created the order.
 - STATUS_STOPPED: Used for unfilled FOK or IOC orders, and for orders that were stopped by the network.
 - STATUS_FILLED: Used for closed fully filled orders.
 - STATUS_REJECTED: Used for orders when not enough collateral was available to fill the margin requirements.
 - STATUS_PARTIALLY_FILLED: Used for closed partially filled IOC orders.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order (set by the system after consensus).

marketID.description: Market identifier for the order. Required field.

partyID.description: Party identifier for the order. Required field.

price.description:
Price for the order, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.
Required field for Limit orders, however it is not required for market orders.

size.description: Size for the order, for example, in a futures market the size equals the number of contracts. Cannot be negative.

side.description: Side for the order, e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL. See [`Side`](#vega.Side). Required field.

timeInForce.description:
Time in force indicates how long an order will remain active before it is executed or expires.
See [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce). Required field.

expiresAt.description:
Timestamp for when the order will expire, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.
Required field only for [`Order.TimeInForce`](#vega.Order.TimeInForce)`.TIF_GTT`.

type.description: Type for the order. See [`Order.Type`](#vega.Order.Type). Required field.

reference.description:
Reference given for the order, this is typically used to retrieve an order submitted through consensus. Currently
set internally by the node to return a unique reference identifier for the order submission.

vegaOrderSubmission.description: An order submission is a request to submit or create a new order on Vega.

vegaOrderType.description:
Type values for an order.

 - TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - TYPE_LIMIT: Used for Limit orders.
 - TYPE_MARKET: Used for Market orders.
 - TYPE_NETWORK: Used for orders where the initiating party is the network (with distressed traders).

id.description: A unique identifier for the party, typically represented by a public key.

vegaParty.description: A party represents an entity who wishes to trade on or query a Vega network.

openVolume.description: Open volume for the position. Value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short.

realisedPNL.description: Realised profit and loss for the position. Value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short.

unrealisedPNL.description: Unrealised profit and loss for the position. Value is signed +ve for long and -ve for short.

averageEntryPrice.description:
Average entry price for the position, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

updatedAt.title: last time the position was updated

vegaPosition.description: Represents position data for a party on the specified market on Vega.

vegaPositionResolution.title: PositionResolution event, a market event indicating number of distressed traders, closed out, at what mark price on which market

value.description:
Price value, given as an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

price.description:
Price for the price level, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

numberOfOrders.description: Number of orders at the price level.

vegaPriceLevel.description: Represents a price level from market depth or order book data.

partyID.description: Party identifier of the author (the party submitting the proposal).

timestamp.description: Proposal timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when proposal was submitted to the network.

terms.description: Proposal configuration and the actual change that is meant to be executed when proposal is enacted.

reason.description: A reason for the current state of the proposal, this may be set in case of REJECTED and FAILED statuses.

vegaProposalError.description:
A list of possible errors that can cause a proposal to be in state rejected or failed.

 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED: Default value.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_CLOSE_TIME_TOO_SOON: The specified close time is too early base on network parameters.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_CLOSE_TIME_TOO_LATE: The specified close time is too late based on network parameters.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_ENACT_TIME_TOO_SOON: The specified enact time is too early based on network parameters.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_ENACT_TIME_TOO_LATE: The specified enact time is too late based on network parameters.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_TOKENS: The proposer for this proposal as insufficient tokens.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_INSTRUMENT_SECURITY: The instrument quote name and base name were the same.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_PRODUCT: The proposal has no product.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PRODUCT: The specified product is not supported.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_FUTURE_PRODUCT_TIMESTAMP: Invalid future maturity timestamp (expect RFC3339).
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_PRODUCT_MATURITY_IS_PASSED: The product maturity is past.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NO_TRADING_MODE: The proposal has no trading mode.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_TRADING_MODE: The proposal has an unsupported trading mode.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_NODE_VALIDATION_FAILED: The proposal failed node validation.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_BUILTIN_ASSET_FIELD: A field is missing in a builtin asset source.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_MISSING_ERC20_CONTRACT_ADDRESS: The contract address is missing in the ERC20 asset source.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INVALID_ASSET: The asset id refer to no assets in vega.
 - PROPOSAL_ERROR_INCOMPATIBLE_TIMESTAMPS: Proposal terms timestamps are not compatible (Validation < Closing < Enactment).

closingTimestamp.description:
Timestamp (Unix time in seconds) when voting closes for this proposal.
Constrained by `minCloseInSeconds` and `maxCloseInSeconds` network parameters.

enactmentTimestamp.description:
Timestamp (Unix time in seconds) when proposal gets enacted (if passed).
Constrained by `minEnactInSeconds` and `maxEnactInSeconds` network parameters.

updateMarket.description: Proposal change for modifying an existing market on Vega.

newMarket.description: Proposal change for creating new market on Vega.

updateNetwork.description: Proposal change for updating Vega network parameters.

newAsset.description: Proposal change for creating new assets on Vega.

vegaProposalTerms.description: Terms for a governance proposal on Vega.

vegaRemoveValidator.description: A message to notify when a validator is being removed from the Vega network.

vegaScalingFactors.description: Scaling Factors (for use in margin calculation).

vegaSettleDistressed.title:
SettleDistressed event per distressed trader who was closed out, any PositionResolution event (market level) will most likely
be followed by a number of these events

vegaSettlePosition.title: SettlePosition data for party: position settlements (part of trader position information)

vegaSide.description:
A side relates to the direction of an order, to Buy, or Sell.

 - SIDE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - SIDE_BUY: Buy order.
 - SIDE_SELL: Sell order.

algo.title: The algorithm used to create the signature

version.title: The version of the signature used to create the signature

vegaSignature.title:
A signature to be authenticate a transaction
and to be verified by the vega network

vegaSignedBundle.description: A bundle of a transaction and it's signature.

factorLong.description: Pre-defined risk factor value for long.

factorShort.description: Pre-defined risk factor value for short.

vegaSimpleModelParams.description: Risk model parameters for simple modelling.

params.description: Risk model params for simple modelling.

blockHeight.description: Current block height as reported by the Vega blockchain.

backlogLength.description: Current backlog length (number of transactions) that are waiting to be included in a block.

totalPeers.description: Total number of connected peers to this node.

genesisTime.description: Genesis block date and time formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision.

currentTime.description: Current system date and time formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision.

vegaTime.description: Current Vega date and time formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision.

status.description:
Status of the connection to the Vega blockchain.
See [`ChainStatus`](#vega.ChainStatus).

totalMarkets.description: Total markets on this Vega network.

totalAmendOrder.description: Total number of order amendments since genesis (on all markets).

totalCancelOrder.description: Total number of order cancellations since genesis (on all markets).

totalCreateOrder.description: Total number of order submissions since genesis (on all markets).

totalOrders.description: Total number of orders affected since genesis (on all markets).

totalTrades.description: Total number of trades emitted since genesis (on all markets).

orderSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to order data.

tradeSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to trade data.

candleSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to candle-stick data.

marketDepthSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to market depth data.

positionsSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to positions data.

accountSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to account data.

marketDataSubscriptions.description: Current number of stream subscribers to market data.

appVersionHash.description: The version hash of the Vega node software.

appVersion.description: The version of the Vega node software.

chainVersion.description: The version of the underlying Vega blockchain.

uptime.description: Total uptime for this node formatted in ISO-8601 datetime format with nanosecond precision.

chainID.description: Unique identifier for the underlying Vega blockchain.

vegaStatistics.description: Vega domain specific statistics as reported by the node the caller is connected to.

vegaTimeUpdate.title: TimeUpdate - event containing the latest block time

vegaTimestamp.description:
A timestamp in nanoseconds since epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

id.description: Unique identifier for the trade (generated by Vega).

marketID.description: Market identifier (the market that the trade occurred on).

price.description:
Price for the trade, the price is an integer, for example `123456` is a correctly
formatted price of `1.23456` assuming market configured to 5 decimal places.

buyer.description: Unique party identifier for the buyer.

seller.description: Unique party identifier for the seller.

aggressor.description: Direction of the aggressive party e.g. SIDE_BUY or SIDE_SELL. See [`Side`](#vega.Side).

buyOrder.description: Identifier of the order from the buy side.

sellOrder.description: Identifier of the order from the sell side.

timestamp.description:
Timestamp for when the trade occurred, in nanoseconds since the epoch.
See [`VegaTimeResponse`](#api.VegaTimeResponse).`timestamp`.

buyerFee.description: Fee amount charged to the buyer party for the trade.

sellerFee.description: Fee amount charged to the seller party for the trade.

buyerAuctionBatch.description: Auction batch number that the buy side order was placed in.

sellerAuctionBatch.description: Auction batch number that the sell side order was placed in.

vegaTrade.description: A trade occurs when an aggressive order crosses one or more passive orders on the order book for a market on Vega.

vegaTradeSettlement.title: TradeSettlement data, part of settle position event

vegaTradeType.description:
Type values for a trade.

 - TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value, always invalid.
 - TYPE_DEFAULT: Normal trading between two parties.
 - TYPE_NETWORK_CLOSE_OUT_GOOD: Trading initiated by the network with another party on the book,
which helps to zero-out the positions of one or more distressed parties.
 - TYPE_NETWORK_CLOSE_OUT_BAD: Trading initiated by the network with another party off the book,
with a distressed party in order to zero-out the position of the party.

account.title: The account relating to the transfer

balance.title: The balance relating to the transfer

vegaTransferBalance.description: Represents the balance for an account during a transfer.

transfers.description: One or more ledger entries representing the transfers.

vegaTransferResponse.description: Represents the response from a transfer.

vegaTransferResponses.title: TransferResponses - a slice of transfer response objects

vegaUpdateMarket.description: Update an existing market on Vega.

sourceID.description: The source identifier of the event.

vegaValidatorEvent.description: An event related to validator management with foreign networks.

proposalID.description: Identifier of the proposal being voted on.

timestamp.description: Vote timestamp for date and time (in nanoseconds) when vote was submitted to the network.

partyID.title: The party which wants to withdraw funds

asset.title: The asset we want to withdraw

vegaWithdrawSubmission.title: A request for withdrawing funds from a trader

asset.title: The asset we want to withdraw funds from

ref.title:
The reference which is used by the foreign chain
to refer to this withdrawal

expiry.title: The time until when the withdrawal is valid

txHash.title: The hash of the foreign chain for this transaction

createdTimestamp.title: The time at which the network started to process this withdrawal

withdrawnTimestamp.title: The time at which the withdrawal was finalized by the network

vegaWithdrawal.title: The representation of a withdrawal in the vega network

vegaWithdrawalStatus.description:
- WITHDRAWAL_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: The default value
 - WITHDRAWAL_STATUS_OPEN: The withdrawal is open and being processed by the network
 - WITHDRAWAL_STATUS_CANCELLED: The withdrawal have been cancelled
 - WITHDRAWAL_STATUS_FINALIZED: The withdrawal went through and is fully finalized (funds remove from the
vega network, and unlocked from the foreign chain bridge)
vegaWithdrawalStatus.title: The status of the withdrawal
